title: Sodom and Gomorrah
summary: Sodom and Gomorrah (/ˈsɒdəm ... ɡəˈmɒrə/) were two legendary biblical cities destroyed by God for their wickedness.[1] Their story parallels the Genesis flood narrative in its theme of God's anger provoked by sin (see Book of Genesis 19:1–28).[2] They are mentioned frequently in the prophets and the New Testament as symbols of human wickedness and divine retribution, and the Quran also contains a version of the story about the two cities.[3] The legend of their destruction may have originated as an attempt to explain the remains of third-millennium Bronze Age cities in the region.[1]
